title: Classroom Seating Arrangement
problem_statement:
Classroom Seating Arrangement

In a classroom, there are N seats numbered 1 to N, and N students are present. Each student, starting from student 1, has a preferred seat represented in an array A. The students enter the classroom one by one and attempt to sit in their preferred seats. If their preferred seat is already occupied, they begin searching for the next available seat in a circular manner.

Your task is to find and return an integer array representing the order in which the seats will get occupied according to their attempts to sit in their preferred seat.

Note:

  • Initially all the seats are empty.
  • \"Circular\" means that if a student\'s preferred seat is already occupied, they start traversing the seats for the next available seat till the Nth seat and then loop around to the beginning of the seating arrangement.

Input Format

  • input1: An integer value N, representing the total number of seats present.
  • input2: An integer array A, representing preferred seats of students.

Output Format

Return an integer array representing the order in which the seats will get occupied according to their attempts to sit in their preferred seats.

Examples

Example 1:

input1: 3
input2: {3,2,2}
{3,2,1}

Given an array with 3 students and their preferred seats {3,2,2}, we can find the final arrangement in the following way:

Initially, all the seats are empty: {0,0,0}.

  • The first student wants seat number 3, which is vacant. They occupy it, resulting in: {3,0,0}.
  • The second student wants seat number 2, which is vacant. They occupy it, resulting in {3,2,0}.
  • The third student wants seat number 2, but it is occupied. They search in a circular manner and find seat number 1 vacant. They occupy it, resulting in the final seating arrangement: {3,2,1}.

Hence, {3,2,1} is returned as the output.

Example 2:

input1: 2
input2: {2,2}
{2,1}

Given an array with 2 students and their preferred seats {2,2}, we can find the final arrangement in the following way:

Initially, all the seats are empty {0,0}.

  • The first student arrives, and their preferred seat is seat number 2. Since it is vacant, they occupy it. The seating arrangement becomes {2,0}.
  • The second student wants seat number 2, but it is occupied. They search in a circular manner and find seat number 1 vacant. They occupy it, resulting in the final arrangement {2,1}.

title: Robo Race
problem_statement:
Robo Race

There is a robot race which two robots named Robotop and Robocop are going to run. Both robots will begin from the same starting point on a circular track. The race starts at time T = 0 seconds. Robotop starts the race at T = Xth second and takes exactly N seconds to complete one lap, while Robocop starts the race at T = Yth second and takes exactly M seconds to complete one lap.

Your task is to find and return an integer value representing the least time T (in seconds) at which these two robots meet each other again at the starting point.

Note:

  • Assume N and M to be co-prime positive integers.
  • Co-prime numbers are those numbers that have only 1 as common factor, e.g. 3 and 5 are co-prime numbers.
  • The time is only considered in seconds.
  • A lap is defined as a complete trip around a race track that is repeated several times during a competition.

Input Format

  • input1: An integer value X, representing the time at which Robotop starts the race.
  • input2: An integer value N, representing the time taken by Robotop to complete a lap.
  • input3: An integer value Y, representing the time at which Robocop starts the race.
  • input4: An integer value M, representing the time taken by Robocop to complete a lap.

Output Format

Return an integer value representing the least time T (in seconds) at which these two robots meet each other again at the starting point.

Examples

Example 1:

input1: 6
input2: 3
input3: 7
input4: 4
15

Here in this example, Robotop starts the race at the 6th second and finishes a lap in 3 seconds while Robocop starts the race at the 7th second and finishes a lap in 4 seconds.

  • Robotop will be at the starting point at the following times: 9, 12, 15, 18... secs
  • and Robocop will be at the starting point at the following times: 11, 15, 19, 23... secs

Therefore, the least time T at which these two robots meet each other again at the starting point is 15 seconds. Hence, 15 is returned as the output.

Example 2:

input1: 3
input2: 3
input3: 10
input4: 1
12

Here in this example, Robotop starts the race at 3rd second and finishes a lap in 3 seconds while Robocop starts the race at 10th second and finishes a lap in 1 second.

  • Robotop will be at the starting point at the following times: 6, 9, 12, 15, ... secs
  • and Robocop will be at the starting point at the following times: 11, 12, 13, 14, ... secs

Therefore, they meet at 12 seconds.
